newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ASX substantial shareholding notices - Aug 20.
newsitem.headline: ASX substantial shareholding notices - Aug 20.

text.p: The following substantial shareholder notices were made to The Australian Stock Exchange (ASX) yesterday.
M.J. O'Halloran ceased to be a substantial shareholder in Computershare Limited on 15/08/1997.

GT Australia Nominees Ltd became a substantial shareholder in Australian Food & Fibre Limited on 18/08/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary share capital of 10,933,030 ordinary shares (6.634%).
Octavo Services Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Formulab Neuronetics Corporation Limited on 14/08/1997, from 150,541,522 ordinary shares (50.49%) to 122,291,222 ordinary shares (41.01%).
A.J. Richter decreased its relevant interest in Formulab Neuronetics Corporation Limited on 14/08/1997, from 150,541,522 ordinary shares (50.40%) to 122,291,222 ordinary shares (41.01%).

Formulab Technology (Australia) Pty Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Formulab Neuronetics Corporation Limited on 14/08/1997, from 150,541,522 ordinary shares (50.49%) to 122,291,222 ordinary shares (41.01%).

International Strategic Alliance Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Formulab Neuronetics Corporation Limited on 14/08/1997, from 150,541,522 ordinary shares (50.49%) to 122,291,222 ordinary shares (41.01%).
Bankers Trust Australia Limited increased its relevant interest in Newcrest Mining Limited on 19/08/1997, from 29,419,397 ordinary shares (12.43%) to 33,260,343 ordinary shares (13.73%).
Bankers Trust Australia Limited decreased its relevant interest in Eastern Gold Corporation NL on 19/08/1997, from 3,900,000 ordinary shares (13.88%) to 3,880,000 ordinary shares (12.40%).
Major Drilling Australia Pty Ltd increased its relevant interest in Mining World Limited on 18/08/1997, from 16,301,763 ordinary shares (92.93%) to 16,304,827 ordinary shares (92.94%).
Perpetual Trustees Australia Ltd decreased its relevant interest in Lynas Gold NL on 15/08/1997, from 7,904,556 ordinary shares (8.12%) to 6,091,394 ordinary shares (6.26%).
Perpetual Trustees Australia Ltd ceased to be a substantial shareholder in Australian United Investment Company Limited on 15/08/1997.
Mercury Asset Management plc decreased its relevant interest in Wiluna Mines Limited on 15/08/1997, from 23,727,287 ordinary shares (14.72%) to 22,291,287 ordinary shares (13.81%).
Deutsche Australia Ltd increased its relevant interest in Peter Kurts Properties Limited on 18/08/1997, from 3,785,370 ordinary shares (5.24%) to 5,035,370 ordinary shares (6.94%).

SAS Trustee Corporation became a substantial shareholder in Peter Kurts Properties Limited on 18/08/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary share capital of 4,286,381 ordinary shares (5.91%).

The Ian Potter Foundation Limited increased its relevant interest in Australian United Investment Company Limited on 23/08/1996 from 20,107,572 ordinary shares (47.0%) to 26,398,843 ordinary shares (49.37%).
RCI Pty Ltd became a substantial shareholder in Alpha Healthcare Limited on 18/08/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary share capital of 4,100,000 ordinary shares (9.4%).

James Hardie Industries Ltd became a substantial shareholder in Alpha Healthcare Limited on 18/08/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary share capital of 4,100,000 ordinary shares (9.4%).
Kilkenny Gold NL became a substantial shareholder in Kalmet Resources NL on 15/08/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary sha re capital of 5,044,850 ordinary shares (6.25%).
Palliser Ltd became a substantial shareholder in Oxiana Resources NL on 15/08/1997 with a relevant interest in the issued ordinary share capital of 5,174,579 ordinary shares (5.48%).
